slug: /160
title: "This Week In React #160: Remix, Next.js, Expo API Routes, Ladle, MDXEditor, Sonner, Docusaurus, AbortController, Query String, Menubar, VisionCamera, Victory Native XL, Bun, ESLint, TC39..."
authors: [slorber]
date: 09-27-2023
---
After a little break, we're catching up on 2 weeks of news this week!

segments.source_content: Learn React.js from the ground up to advanced topics like performance, testing, and code quality. Start by building a real-world app in the Complete Introduction to React. Continue with Intermediate React, integrating the most popular tools from the ecosystem. Then learn performance, TypeScript, and even Next.js, the fullstack React framework!

segments.source_content: As expected, Remix v2 should be a relatively straightforward upgrade, since many v2 features were already available in v1 as opt-in 'future flags'. This article gives an overview of all the flags that were delivered in v1 and are now enabled by default in v2. Remix also offers retro-compatibility packages for those who preferred some v1 conventions. React Server Component support should land in Remix v3.

translations.fr: Comme prÃ©vu, Remix v2 devrait Ãªtre une mise Ã  niveau relativement simple, car de nombreuses fonctionnalitÃ©s v2 Ã©taient dÃ©jÃ  disponibles en v1 via des 'future flags' optionnelles. Cet article donne un aperÃ§u de tous les flags livrÃ©s en v1 et maintenant activÃ©s par dÃ©faut en v2. Remix propose Ã©galement des packages de rÃ©trocompatibilitÃ© pour ceux qui prÃ©fÃ©raient certaines conventions v1. Le support des React Server Components devrait arriver dans Remix v3.
translations.en: Comme prÃ©vu, Remix v2 devrait Ãªtre une mise Ã  jour relativement simple, car de nombreuses fonctionnalitÃ©s v2 Ã©taient dÃ©jÃ  disponibles en v1 via des 'future flags' optionnels. Cet article donne un aperÃ§u de tous les flags livrÃ©s en v1 et dÃ©sormais activÃ©s par dÃ©faut en v2. Remix propose aussi des packages de rÃ©trocompatibilitÃ© pour ceux prÃ©fÃ©rant certaines conventions v1. Le support des React Server Components devrait arriver dans Remix v3.

segments.source_content: Many developers complained about the slowness of the Next.js dev server lately. Vercel heard us and came up with another rlease that significantly improves things.

translations.fr: De nombreux dÃ©veloppeurs se sont plaints de la lenteur du serveur de dÃ©veloppement Next.js rÃ©cemment. Vercel nous a entendus et propose une nouvelle version qui amÃ©liore significativement la situation.

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ’¸ [Ably Realtime Hackathon - Create a real-time React app, win $19,000 in prizes - from real-time dashboards to collaborative experiences!](https://ably.devpost.com/?utm_campaign=23-hackathon&utm_source=thisweekinreact&utm_medium=referral)
- ğŸ¦ ["StyleX documentation site is nearly ready for launch"](https://twitter.com/naman34/status/1703576411330810282)
- â“ [Did the React team forget the React Forget compiler?](https://www.reddit.com/r/reactjs/comments/16nnh4z/did_the_react_team_forget_the_react_forget/): Joseph and Sathya respond on Reddit. They are making progress and starting to experiment in production. We'll know more at React Advanced next month.
- ğŸ‘€ [Vercel v0 alpha - "Midjourney for React"](https://v0.dev/): Vercel introduced a preview of an impressive AI capable of writing React components based on shadcn UI and Tailwind, and easy to copy/paste.
- ğŸ’¡ [Await Component - Use Suspense without creating a new component](https://buildui.com/recipes/await-component): a useful technique inspired by Remix.
- ğŸ“œ [Speeding up the JavaScript ecosystem - Polyfills gone rogue](https://marvinh.dev/blog/speeding-up-javascript-ecosystem-part-6/): many ESLint plugins like `eslint-plugin-react` come with a lot of unnecessary dependencies.
- ğŸ“œ [The State of Web Frameworks on Deno](https://deno.com/blog/web-frameworks-on-deno): gives a good overview of the React frameworks that can be hosted on Deno Deploy. Next.js support is limited, but Remix and Astro seem to be well-supported. I've discovered that they've migrated their docs to Docusaurus ğŸ¥².
- ğŸ“œ [Abort Async Calls Inside Remix Loaders and Actions](https://sergiodxa.com/tutorials/abort-async-calls-inside-remix-loaders-and-actions): explains how to correctly manage the AbortSignal received in a Remix loader. There are a few pitfalls to avoid.
- ğŸ“œ [Build a server-side filter UI with Remix](https://www.jacobparis.com/content/remix-filter-bar): offers a complete solution and a great demo for creating advanced filters inspired by the Linear app. TIL about the OData spec, which defines how to serialize filters as query string.
- ğŸ“œ [Storing React state in the URL with Next.js](https://francoisbest.com/posts/2023/storing-react-state-in-the-url-with-nextjs): eencourages the use of the query string via a `next-usequerystate` package. v1.8 is out and supports Next.js App Router. Also shares a few details I didn't know about, such as the browser rate-limit on `history.replaceState` calls.
- ğŸ“œ [Displaying Local Times in Next.js](https://francoisbest.com/posts/2023/displaying-local-times-in-nextjs): interesting tips to avoid hydration mismatch problems.
- ğŸ“œ [Islands & Server Components & Resumability, Oh My!](https://dev.to/this-is-learning/islands-server-components-resumability-oh-my-319d): the 3 approaches are orthogonal and could converge?
- ğŸ“œ [A First Look at HTMX and How it Compares to React](https://www.builder.io/blog/htmx-vs-react)
- ğŸ“œ [React Server Components Made Our Site Faster](https://frigade.com/blog/bundle-size-reduction-with-rsc-and-frigade)

segments.source_content: I've been looking forward to this! Expo is getting into server-side features by offering to deploy API Routes via an Expo Router convention. You can deploy these routes yourself, and soon on popular hosts, but it's clear that the long-term goal is to suggest hosting the server runtime in EAS.

translations.fr: J'attendais cela avec impatience ! Expo se lance dans les fonctionnalitÃ©s cÃ´tÃ© serveur en proposant de dÃ©ployer des routes d'API via une convention Expo Router. Vous pouvez dÃ©ployer ces routes vous-mÃªme, et bientÃ´t sur des hÃ©bergeurs populaires, mais il est clair que l'objectif Ã  long terme est de suggÃ©rer d'hÃ©berger le runtime serveur dans EAS.
translations.en: Je l'attendais avec impatience ! Expo se lance dans les fonctionnalitÃ©s cÃ´tÃ© serveur en proposant de dÃ©ployer des Routes API via une convention Expo Router. Vous pouvez dÃ©ployer ces routes vous-mÃªme, et bientÃ´t sur des hÃ´tes populaires, mais il est clair que l'objectif Ã  long terme est de suggÃ©rer d'hÃ©berger le runtime serveur dans EAS.

segments.source_content: This marks the start of a new era for Expo. Having solved the problem of native mobile, it's now time to make cross-platform a mainstream reality by filling the gaps in web support with Server Side Rendering and React Server Components.

translations.fr: Cela marque le dÃ©but d'une nouvelle Ã¨re pour Expo. AprÃ¨s avoir rÃ©solu le problÃ¨me du mobile natif, il est maintenant temps de faire du cross-platform une rÃ©alitÃ© grand public en comblant les lacunes de la prise en charge web avec le rendu cÃ´tÃ© serveur (Server Side Rendering) et les React Server Components.
translations.en: Cela marque le dÃ©but d'une nouvelle Ã¨re pour Expo. Ayant rÃ©solu le problÃ¨me du mobile natif, il est maintenant temps de faire du cross-platform une rÃ©alitÃ© grand public en comblant les lacunes de la prise en charge web avec le Server Side Rendering et les React Server Components.
